intro: Miltitzia inyoensis, commonly known as the Inyo miltitzia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are generally small and opposite, with a rough, sometimes hairy texture. Miltitzia inyoensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
